title: 52% of Owners Interested in Increasing Energy Efficiency
text:
52% of Owners Interested in Increasing Energy Efficiency
Image by Bud.hu
More than half of property owners (52%) are interested in home renovation projects aimed at increasing energy efficiency, according to a survey of 1,000 people commissioned by OTP Otthon and OTP Bank.
Most people think about insulating their houses and replacing windows, but many would also invest in solar panels and heat pumps. Especially if they also receive state support.
On July 1, the residential home renovation subsidy was launched, thanks to which the state will provide up to HUF 6 million in the form of an interest-free loan and non-refundable subsidy for the energy modernization of family houses built before the end of 1990.
This aims to encourage the energy modernization of residential buildings, contributing to renovating more than 20,000 family houses.
Some 14.3% of the costs must be self-financed, the maximum amount of the interest-free loan and the non-refundable subsidy can be HUF 6 mln, and energy savings of at least 30% must be achieved as evidenced by the renovat ion.
